etymology.description: 糸(糸) (sī, "silk") + 糸(糸) (sī, "silk") = intertwined threads -> silk/thread
etymology.interpretation: The character 絲(絲) (sī, "silk") symbolizes the concept of silk or thread by combining two 糸(糸) (sī, "silk") components, representing weaving or threading.
etymology.simplification: 絲(絲) was simplified to 丝 by replacing the stacked 糸(糸) forms with a cursive and more streamlined 𢇁 representation.

examples.chinese: 他选用蚕丝(他選用蠶絲)，制作精美的围巾(製作精美的圍巾)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xuǎn yòng cán sī, zhì zuò jīng měi de wéi jīn.
examples.english: He selects silkworm silk to make a beautiful scarf.

examples.chinese: 古代诗人常以丝(古代詩人常以絲)，比喻柔情(比喻柔情)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ dài shī rén cháng yǐ sī, bǐ yù róu qíng.
examples.english: Ancient poets often used silk as a metaphor for tenderness.

examples.chinese: 这件披肩由丝(這件披肩由絲)织成(織成)精细的花纹(精細的花紋)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiàn pī jiān yóu sī zhī chéng jīng xì de huā wén.
examples.english: This shawl is woven from silk into intricate patterns.
